_description: A song in praise of Christ and the Virgin Mary — four quatrains (abab) and burden: ‘Honour be euer wiþowtyn ende / To hym þat fro þe hevyn discende’

CamTCC652.First Lines:
That was Ihesu oure saueourThe oonly son of god
                    myghty…
CamTCC652.Last Lines:
…That was the cause god son descendeffor to be borne here for
                    oure sele
CamTCC652.Note:
Burden and parts of stanza 1 written as a scribble, another hand, f.
                        170v.
CamTCC652.Editions:
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 137; 1977, 120.
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 110.
